website_summaries.verdict: Excellent craftsmanship in the traditional style makes this axe a force to be reckoned with.
pros: Wood handle is cut on the grain, providing extra strength
High-quality steel holds its edge but also sharpens well
cons: A few users had the blade break during regular use

customer_reviews.title: Broke like many others. Bad steel.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, this axe broke under normal use the first time I took it camping. It was a Christmas present and purchased over 90 days before. It was clearly a defect, and broke in the same spot as many others. It is junk. Not worth the money, particularly with the bad warranty and lacking customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first use. Was within 90 day warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke during first use. Was within 90 day warranty period, getting a new one wasn't too much of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Letostak

customer_reviews.title: Sent hatchet with fractured wood at top, and long ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent hatchet with fractured wood at top, and long, dark split in handle that you could stick your finger nail in. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am now all-powerful
customer_reviews.text: In the woods, nothing stands in my way when wielding this hatchet. Animals run from me, trees either bow out of the way or get destroyed. I am become death, destroyer of worlds. At home, this hatchet sits on my coat rack. When people I don't know come knocking, this hatchet dangles hauntingly from my hand. That way, they know I mean business and that they shouldn't tarry. Thank you, Husqvarna, for supplying me with an affordable defensive/time saving device. I look forward to purchasing more lovely pieces in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DanLightning

customer_reviews.title: I’ll Start off by saying that I love this axe
customer_reviews.text: I’ll Start off by saying that I love this axe. It’s a great piece and I use it much more often than my expensive axes. ( gransfors bruk) but I might have gotten a bad handle on mine. I’m sure not all of them are this way. But it was NOT hung correctly to the head. Came loose, very loose on the first use. And husqvarna would not warranty it or send me a new handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defect
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this ax for a camping trip but when I received it, it had a crack on the top of the ax. Multiple cracks on the wooden part. I was very disappointed when I got this product. I initially heard good things about this ax but was let down.
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Brittle axe head that breaks!
customer_reviews.text: The brittle axe head broke after a handful of uses. Too bad because I liked the feel of it. 90 day warranty makes sense now...they’d run out of money replacing all of these!
customer_reviews.author: Cory A.

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced
customer_reviews.text: I love this little axe and saw all the wonderful reviews and the first time I used it the axe head broke (hairline fracture) and I had to clamp and weld. Now I have love my little axe again and I have never seen this issue in any other reviews so I would recommend as it holds a sharp edge and is well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wait to get this
customer_reviews.text: if you have been spitting wood with a budget maul, drop the coin and get this one. Fewer strokes to spilt up big logs. lighter head makes it easier on the shoulder, with a faster delivery. Taper of the spitting edge is the key, allows you to avoid bounces. Shorter handle improves accuracy. Over the years, i have split 20+ cords of oak with an old home depot budget 6 lbs maul. Just finished my first cord with this, and am mad I waited so long to get it. Appears to hold an edge well. Handle delivered unfinished so expect to add a few coats of BLO. Ps advark trading appears to be bailey’s forestry product.
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped, overpriced, but it won't break. Handle lets it down.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, if you're looking for a small hatchet look at the new Husqvarna "camping axe" first, it has a lighter head and it has a proper sheath with belt loop. This axe is slightly too heavy to take backpacking anywhere. To be honest the handle is pretty cheap. Narrow and the same width throughout. Difficult to choke up on the handle at the same time because it's so thick up top. I think Husqvarna knows people will pay an extra $10 for something that looks pretty. You can find cheaper and better forged 2 pound head axes if you really look, (marbles and some others) don't let the internet hype take hold of you.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: One Beast of a Hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: How could I resist a Swedish made axe, for under $40. Husqvarna outsource their axes to Hultafors Burks, and just stamp the handle with their name. (Hultafors Burks has been making axes in Sweden since 1697.) I have quite an assortment of Gransfors Bruks ($$$$$), Helko Werk ($$$), and Wettlingers ($$$) Axes. I rate my new Husqvarna Hatchet just below these other brands. The grind is not at the same level, but it’s still as razor sharp. Also, it came with a beautiful straight-grained Hickory handle that rivals any on the axes above. Only negative or ‘weak spot I see is in the forging : they put the “Made In Sweden”, text line into the cheek.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz as in Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Beat mine up and works like new
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews where people broke their axe somehow after a couple uses, but that has not been my experience, quite the opposite. I had a learning curve getting 'the swing of it' <lol> and it has the dings and scuffs and splinters to prove it, but it's going strong. Periodic quick sharpen with a bastard file, some sanding of the handle at the head where I've missed the center of the log a few times, and a little tung oil to hydrate the wood (it sits on top of my truck most of the time) and it's still a satisfying JOY to use.
customer_reviews.author: davedigerati

customer_reviews.title: Great value with 2 design flaws to be aware of
customer_reviews.text: These are great axes for the money. The handle is a little bulky and the stamping of the Husqvarna name is in a terrible spot for longevity as many have shown with broken axes. I have a few of these and they’ve held up well but please Husqvarna stamp the logo elsewhere. Your brand name shouldn’t be the failure point of an otherwise great product. Just silly
customer_reviews.author: NWOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Great product needs to be finished by the consumer to make his own!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast arrived undamaged the grain on the handle is about perfect . The finish of the axe head is incomplete as expected and as I prefer! Now I can spend as much time as needed to make this tool awesome . This is my 4th husqvarna wood handled axe all have turned out awesome and scarry sharp . Just sanded down the handles from 80 grit to 220 and sealed with boiled linseed oil . If you want a 150$ axe at a great price and are will to put 2 hours of work into something you will treasure .you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Mattstevens

customer_reviews.title: abysmal quality..
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality axe. I have several Russian, Ukrainian and Chinese made axes and none of them has such a horrible unlikely geometry of an axe head. One side is concave another is convex, and this is my second sample which is better than a first one. Yes, yes it is made in Sweden by hands but it is probably was made by someone who just started to make it or they have special department on a plant that makes sure you got really garbage like profiled axes. I of course will use my high speed bench grinder in order to bring it to good shape, but really Sweden and such a lopsided tools. Shame, just shame
customer_reviews.author: Vasya

customer_reviews.title: Best Hatchet I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet by Husqvarna is an exceptional well made tool. The hammer forged head is rock solid, easy to sharpen and retains its sharp edge longer than other hatchets I've used. The handle has a tight weave grain and is very durable. I read some comments about some complaints that the head is too heavy. I for one am very satisfied with the heavier head as it passes through splitting logs with ease. I like this hatchet so much that I purchased a second one. I highly recommend this cutting tool to anyone in the market of purchasing a quality hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice camp axe for an adult, nice fullsize axe for an 8-year-old.
customer_reviews.text: It's handmade, the perfect size for me to use as a hand-and-a-half camp axe/large hatchet, perfect for 8-yo Lil Nephew to use as a proper axe for his size. If you're felling timber, you'll want something with more meat to it (or, y'know, a saw, preferably gas-powered), but for making a campfire, cutting trails between the big trees, etc., you could do worse with far more money. The finish is a bit rough, but that's part of the charm, it's hand-forged and all. My brother who collects and restores vintage axes said it's good enough for him.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Baker

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This axe is a beast. The edge it came with was workable but ruff and off kilter. I changed the geometry and put a really keen edge on it to do a lot of fine task. I have used it to build shelters and other task and is my main axe to carry in my bushcraft pack. It's weight is a bit different from others and has a strange curve to get use to but when you do you'll love it. Convinced my dad to get one to.
customer_reviews.author: C-Rad

customer_reviews.title: What now?
customer_reviews.text: I always read reviews and when I bought this axe I didn't see these reviews or I wouldn't of bought it. You start spending a lot and it seems they start tweaking reviews to keep you on a roll. I fell ridiculous taking this axe out to possibly hurt myself or someone else. Can I get a refund I wonder if I send it back without it being broken? With all the other matching break sights, how can they not recall these things?
customer_reviews.author: Joel De La Vega

customer_reviews.title: Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic axe for the money. Out of the box, it doesn't compare to my Gransfors Brux but I didn't expect it to. The handle isn't as smooth and would cause quick discomfort to your hands if used as-is. Also the blade was ground very coarse and without much care in comparison. The Swedish forging seems to be great however which is all that matters. After an hour of perfecting the edge and sanding the handle and working in some linseed oil, I am thrilled to have made this purchase. It also came with an excellent sheath which I almost like more than the sheath that came on the Gransfors.
customer_reviews.author: Deans

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool but quality control does not seem to exist
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool but quality control does not seem to exist. Like many others have said, it would be advised to buy this in person at a store so you can check it out good. The edge needed work but that's usually true on even high end axes. But the head was not hung well. There are gaps that should not be there and the head is not on center with the handle. Further more, not only is the head off center but it also is twisted so it's not lined up with the handle. Is it usable,,,sure, but issues like that should be found by QC, not a customer.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Hands-down the best buy for anyone looking to do primitive woodworking. It will need some file work to get the bevel just right
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaZorkaS

customer_reviews.title: Great edge retention
customer_reviews.text: I finally put down my long term Chinese made axe and have been working with this one for a few months now. Cleaned up the profile and went to work. Great edge retention! After a few hours of use, the weaker hand portion of the handle will create a hot spot that needed to be address with a little sanding. Yes I still have girly hands from everyday career. lol You wont be disappointed if you receive the quality that I did. Happy processing fellas!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's a very nice little hatchet
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice little hatchet. Mine had a very straight wood grain and a beautiful handle before treatment with boiled linseed oil. I would recommend the treatment and a handle protected, I am wrapping mine in orange 550 cord, just to keep the handle pretty. The stock sheath is a small brown leather one of some sort. It can slip off with a tug, so if you are carrying this axe for camping or strapping it to a pack I would recommend an upgrade to the helko axe sheath, hatchet size fits this axe perfect with no need to resize or reshape. Other pictures already show the wedging and head so I'll attach some dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much I got a second one for my dad!
customer_reviews.text: Got it on sale at a ridiculous price (about half). Doesnt come super sharp but what do you expect at this price range? Spent a good 2 hours honing the blade and its razor sharp. Best bang for your buck on the market right now. Also dont be a ditz and twist the axe. Improper use is whats causing these to break. Always only pull up and down. if you go side to side or wiggle wiggle youre asking for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Beware of sheath
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet seems to be of good quality but the quality control lacks. I guess thats how the cut the costs. Careful with the sheath because the blade will touch the rivets and will damage the blade as shown in the photos. This is how I got it in the mail. It doesn't help that Amazon just throws the hatchet in a box thats way too big for it without any type of protection. I was able to get a pretty sharp edge after a little TLC. Grain on the one I got is not great but not the worst either. Overall its a good hatchet at a fraction of the cost of others out there.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this hatchet. I love the multi-use forest axe by Husqvarna so I thought this would be the same. It just fell flat for me. It doesn't stay sharp as long as as the multi-use, it doesn't take an edge as well either. If you're like me you think you need both... you don't. I've not been in one situation where I need or want this more than it's big brother. It's not much lighter only shorter. It's not a bad hatchet, just not great either hence the 3 star review.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna Carpenter's Axe
customer_reviews.text: The performance of the Carpenter's axe is superb for carving, hewing, and splitting kindling. It is very well designed, and the workmanship is better than I expected at this price. The head is very nicely forged and is properly ground. The head alignment is nearly perfect, and it is tightly mounted to the handle without any significant gaps. The handle has very tight grain with excellent grain orientation, and the finish is superb. While the price is much lower than the similar axe from Gransfors Bruk the quality is about as good. It just needed a touch of sharpening. This is a terrific small axe, and a great value. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Elroy

customer_reviews.title: Update! Happy Father’s Day!
customer_reviews.text: Never got it. Under current investigation with ups. Amazon not able to correct error Since Sold by third party. Will give update if rectified: Update: product was sent to my neighbor. Chopping axes 23”, 27”, and hatchet are amazing. Indestructible and sharp. I added a tennis wrap to the 27” chopping axe since it has some hand shock when hit wrong. Like a golf club. Minor inconvenience compared to dealing with wooden handles. Center point of balance is next to the head of the axe. Chopped my tree down and I’m excited to get to the next. Happy Fathers Day!
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna and distributor need better quality control
customer_reviews.text: The axe is exactly what I wanted with good size and weight but I am disappointed with the quality control. The round steel wedge is way off center and sitting against the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest guy

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: So what if it doesn't have a steel handle. It seems strong enough, is finely balanced, and the curve of the handle seems to considerably increase the strength of the blow. I've used Estwing and several other brands, and this is the only one I now care to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Baumli

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Great little hatchet for small camp tasks. Mine came sharp. Used a Lanskys puck to sharpen after a weekends worth of use and had no issues getting it sharp. Sanded down the handle and applied a few coats of boiled linseed oil. Also drilled a hole in the sheath and put a piece of shock cord through it to loop around the back so the sheath stays on
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Costs more by any other name
customer_reviews.text: A Swedish made hatchet of this quality usually costs over $100.00. That alone should be enough to buy this tool. It's well made, and I personally like the handle shape. Some have comment on the level of sharpness out of the box, but more and more companies don't deliver the keenest edge for legal purposes, and I don't mind touching up my tools to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Prague

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Purpose Items Never Excel At Anything - True For This Axe too
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this axe for 2+ years now and I have used it extensively in chopping, crafting, and splitting. The handle is great for chopping, and not really good for hachetting or crafting -- too long. The axe head is too light for splitting so you have to put too much energy into it. The metal holds an edge really good. Overall, it's a good all around axe. If I can do the purchase again I would get the splitting axe and then a hatchet. BUT, if you can only take 1 axe out this may suit your needs for hachet and chopping...not really good at splitting.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna Carpenters Axe
customer_reviews.text: This is one fine tweener. I needed something heavier than a hatchet and smaller than an axe and this is perfect. Well made with a heavy duty leather sheath also. I had a smaller 1.25 lb. husqvarna hatchet that I got a while ago from Home Depot, and thought that was a well made product. Solid, held a nice edge. This product is no different, solid and holds a nice edge also. Very pleased and satisfied. I may buy another one, just because....... Seller also provided excellent and fast service. I own around 7-8 hatchets and axes and this may well become my favorite all purpose tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mylo Mylo

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T BEAT THE VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. The handle grain orientation looked good and it seems to be boiled linseed oil treated already. There were some rolls on the edge; but they were very tiny, not a show stopper. Nicely weighted. Not so heavy that you don't want to carry it to a camp site but, heavy enough to split wood with a couple of strikes. For the intermediate/beginning camper, you won't go wrong with this one. For the price, you can afford to make mistakes with it, with out breaking the bank. Purchase another sheath. The one it comes with does not protect the edge well. I think it's intent is to protect you or your pack from the edge.
customer_reviews.author: LiteningKid

customer_reviews.title: Glad I didn't spring for the $200 version of this ...
customer_reviews.text: Glad I didn't spring for the $200 version of this Axe. I purchased this for general camp use and for making kindling. This axe does the job well! There are plenty of YouTube videos out there showing how ton refinish the handle of the axe with boiled linseed oil and how to put a quality edge on the axe - although it showed up with a nice edge. I did purchase the competitor's sheath off Amazon for short money, as many reviews claimed the Husq sheath had rivets that could damage the blade. So, if you're deciding between this axe and a $200 and you're using the axe for general use around camp, DO IT!!!! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JBoogy27

customer_reviews.title: overall quality is good but the hatched feels cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: overall quality is good but the hatched feels cumbersome,heavy and unbalanced. I also own a husqvarna forest axe and it is hard to believe that they both come from the same manufacturer when you put them in your hand,because the forest axe handles beautifully and is very nice to work with. I expected similar from the hatched but I deceided that in order to be of any use for me i will cut the beard away and sand the handle to a much skinnier profile because at present it is not proportional ,thicker than the axe handle which is for two handled use. I still believe that the husqvarna range of axes are good quality and value for money.
customer_reviews.author: monica ehret

customer_reviews.title: Crack n handle,,, junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk!! crack n handle huge chip n the head I sent it back for n American made marbles hatchet
customer_reviews.author: Josh w.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ax I've ever owned! The previous two I bought at Home Depot and had the handle break and returned it for a new handle. The 2nd time I gave the ax to my parents because I asked for this ax for my birthday. The axe was very sharp when I received it. It came with a plastic cover to protect the cutting edge and it's not to heavy or to light. I have no doubt it will last another 10 years : ).
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: I should have gotten something a little lighter with better workmanship
customer_reviews.text: First impression was that it is uncomfortably top heavy when held on the end part of the handle. More manageable holding it close to the head but an ax for shaving and camp work doesn't need to be so heavy. I should have gotten something a little lighter with better workmanship. Real rough grind marks with no attempt for an even black finish to grind appearance. Does take a good edge. Good for splitting and hammering. Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kdog

customer_reviews.title: Nice hatchet at a good price
customer_reviews.text: $42 for a hatchet hand-forged by 300 year old Swedish company Hults Bruk is a great deal. It's a slightly heavier hatchet, about 2.2 lbs so it may take just a little while to get used to. But for me, I prefer the extra 4-8 oz. and let the tool do the work. Nice hickory handle which I lightly sanded and applied linseed oil.
customer_reviews.author: Pete S

customer_reviews.title: An immensley pleased birthday gift recipient!
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was for my son who was absolutely thrilled to receive it. More importantly, he has put this axe to the test on several logging & forestry applications with the axe performing efficiently and exceedingly well. Highly recommended. I also own two of the carpenter's axes by Husqvarna, both of which are high quality and versatile tools.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.J.B

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Small Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Husqvarna, from what I have learned, uses good quality steel for the heads of their hatchets and axes. I am happy with my purchase. I got good quality without the price some other companies charge for similar products. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: easily made superb with some tlc
customer_reviews.text: should come with belt loop or full sheath...Edge is manageable, but not what you'd expect from the companies reputation...easily made superb with some tlc, and skill with a sharpening stone. Sheath that come with Hatchet doesn't hold on, it just hangs out, and if it's not bothered will be there until removed, but easily removed even while buttoned on. Otherwise, after some edge repair, beast of a hatchet for the money. (Thinner handle would make for better ease of use, but oh well)
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: I am concerned about all of the reviews of broken steel. But so far it seems great. It came without the blade cover/shieth, but I intend to make a better cover. The handle grain was straight and seems strong and tight. The makers mark seem stamped to heavily into the blade steel and may be the cause of the steel breakage. It should be further back on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I'd pass
customer_reviews.text: Pretty clunky axe. It took a nice hone and cuts well, but to be honest, I don't like the feel. The head feels overly heavy and unbalanced. It may serve someone else's need better than mine. After this one, I ordered a Grans Fors Bruk Small Forest Axe and it is a complete joy. No comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Tall and Toothy

customer_reviews.title: all around good axe
customer_reviews.text: Handle is not coated, came fairly sharp, and has served me well.The only issues i have had with the axe is after felling a few trees about 8" in diameter one that was 24" the head has shifted slightly from the eye, my guess would be the largish gaps in where the handle meets the head. over all still a good all purpose axe i use for every axe need i have besides craving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tools
customer_reviews.text: Amazing axe for the price! I hated the shelac on the handle so I scraped and put many layers of linseed oil on it . It handles great, I carry it as my wedge pounder and limb chopper when dropping trees. Very versatile tool. You coouuuullld chop a whole tree with it IF you had too, but I suspect the people who wrote that in their reviews haven't done much timber work. They should buy a proper felling axe if that's what they use it for. Having said that though, this tool is up to any task you put it too. I will probably always buy husqavarna axes and hatchets. Great edge on it, but needed a little attention.
customer_reviews.author: ang

customer_reviews.title: Best axe I have used for heavy duty labor
customer_reviews.text: Bullet proof axe that holds a sharp edge. You can pry and wedge stumps, logs and split wood. I've also used the hammer side for driving stakes and breaking random stuff haha. I use this axe for my job and its held up better than all my wood handled axes $100 +
customer_reviews.author: Robet Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Two years.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this axe extensively. Felled tress, limbed trees, firewood split, stock removal while carving and I'm always struck how perfectly it works. Innumerable cords of firewood. How the depth of the bite it takes only takes minor changes in the velocity or angle of my swing. It took some work on the bit to get just right but the fact of the matter is the bit was really good enough for most wood cutting out of the box. I have a small army of axes with two other swedes in the bunch but this one is by far my favorite. It's truly an efficient jack of all trades.
customer_reviews.author: DavidGeeTop Contributor: Blues Music

customer_reviews.title: R U Kidding Me!
customer_reviews.text: R U Kidding me!!!! Hand forged with love for $26 on Amazon when u can go get a Home Depot brand without any love for $20, this is a no brainier! It's BEAUTIFUL, grain orientation is awesome, fit finish is awesome, did I mention HAND FORGED! Came sharp too which some people say theirs didn't BUT mine did. I will be sending down handle tomorrow and getting Boiled Linseed Oil all over this the next 7 days. With hunting season started right now in October I will be getting plenty use out of it thru January.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A classic.
customer_reviews.text: Yeahhhhh. I think this might be the perfect hatchet. Some call it an axe, but I call a one handed axe a hatchet. Anyway. This thing is top quality, a terrific value, and I love the handle shape. Hatchets are very prone to subjective judgemenet, but this one rang all of my bells. Are there better ones out there? Sure. For a couple of hundred bucks or even way more depending on what you buy. Does this one present a perfect combination of utility, value, performance and durability? It does for me. This has earned a permanent home in my camping gear. HIghly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Great Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought a Gransfor Bruk Wildlife hatchet and wound up giving it to my son as it was a bit small and I was pretty disappointed with the (lack of quality) leather sheath. Also I think price matters and the Gransfor was $120. Well I bought this hatchet for $40 and love it. One clarification for everyone, Husqvarna no longer makes a 13" hatchet, this is a 15" handled hatchet and as such heavier than listed. I like that, it really delivers a blow and it is very sharp, great steel and easy to sharpen. Nothing, I mean Nothing is like Sweedish high carbon steel!!!
customer_reviews.author: yellowstonetodd

customer_reviews.title: A little elbow grease
customer_reviews.text: This axe is practically an un-polished Hults Bruk. Put it a little work and it is great axe. I use it for a camp axe, and I leave it in the truck year round. Just too handy not to. Holds an edge like nobodies business, and the straight bit makes it easy to sharpen. The Sheath was loose fit, but I don't mind that too much.
customer_reviews.author: James Q.

customer_reviews.title: Really like this hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I don't own many of these type of hatches but compared to the ones you buy from the the big box stores and sporting goods outlets this thing is light years ahead. I like it a lot. Its not light, but to me that is a good thing when using it for a while. The quality is great. I'm sure there are much better out there but this one is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: LondonCarroll

customer_reviews.title: Nice hatchet
customer_reviews.text: With a 26" handle, this is really just a heavy duty hatchet. It is not fit for heavy-duty tasks. However, I love the quality of the steel. I split up a cord of seasoned oak and it was still razor sharp when I was done. The balance is excellent and the shaft has great alignment. I would like to buy a heavier version for bigger tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value.
customer_reviews.text: Vary high quality camp hatchet. The weight of the head and blade profile cause it to cut like a much larger ax. Swedish forged ax steel - if you are familiar with it you know - if not it would take a small book to explain (the Gransfors Bruks ax book). I have 2 gransfors bruks, the foresters ax and the camp hatchet. They are the pinnacle, but this little hatchet is surprisingly close in functional quality; just not as refined as to edge etc. Excellent value for a quality tool that may be in the family for generations.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Fried

customer_reviews.title: Buy it...now!
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. Now. It is one of the stellar deals out there. Be prepared to stone down thevedgecand hone it. (never use a file on an axe) Diamond files work really well though. A Lansky Puck is good too. Sand the handle with 150 grit (or so) and apply multiple coats of Boiled Linseed Oil...or Pure Tung Oil diluted 50% with Mineral Spirits. Do that and you'll end up with a Carpenter's Axe every bit as good as a Wetterlings or Gransfors for a half to a quarter of the price. This is a true gem!
customer_reviews.author: Blackhorse

customer_reviews.title: Best axe for the money by far
customer_reviews.text: I've really become a fan of these Husqvarna axes, I now own the Carpenter's axe, the multi-purpose ("forest") axe, & the hatchet. All are extremely well made, especially for the money, & if you can't afford a gransfors & bruks like me these will do just fine. These are on a whole different level than condor, Collins(new), Council & the like. This particular axe came very sharp (I had to sharpen the forest axe), & the grain orientation was great (forest axe had pretty bad grain, but it's luck of the draw I guess). I would DEFINITELY recommend this axe!
customer_reviews.author: Nakmuay

customer_reviews.title: Good Axe for the $
customer_reviews.text: The orientation of grain in the wood on the handle is about 45deg off what is optimal but at least it’s not 90deg off. It’s also a $90 axe and not a $220 GFB so I can’t be too picky. The head seems to loose its edge a little faster than I figured it would but that’s highly subjective. 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kengineer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Super value. Very nice axe. If you want it razor sharp then plan on sharpening it. I bought the multi purpose axe so I could learn how to chop wood and sharpen the axe. I didn't want to spend a lot on the high dollor axes to learn on. Eventually I bought a high dollor small Forrest axe. I keep coming back to my husqvarna because it is so perfect in my hands. This tool just plain works. It has very high quality steel and will last a very long time. Buy it you will not be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This hatchet has very good weight for it's size
customer_reviews.text: I'm really loving this hatch. I found that an large ax was more than I needed for some camping trips and figured I'd give the Husqvarna a try; I was blown away. At a more than reasonable I didn't expect to be this impressed. This hatchet has very good weight for it's size, the wood grain was straight, and it had a nice tight mushroom at the head. I've haven't had a chance to use it much, but it's definitely going out with me on my next camping trip. An excellent purchase and a steal at the price..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality budget Swedish steel.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a general purpose bushcraft axe and it's done everything I've asked of it. Could probably upgrade to a full size axe for heavier chopping and leverage but then you would lose out on how handy this thing really is. Easy to keep a scary sharp edge on it. Good steel, good straight grain in the handle. Worth way more than they are asking for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: 10 Milly Meter

customer_reviews.title: Best reasonably priced Swedish small forest axe available
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a couple of years now, so it's time for a "seasoned" review. Best reasonably priced Swedish small forest axe available. Performs as well as a "W" or "GFB" at 1/3 the price. Takes and holds a great edge. Mine arrived "shaving sharp" right out of the box.. A couple of minutes with a stone (don't even need to use a file) every few days keeps it ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: keltyfan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better product, or price for that matter
customer_reviews.text: Such a nice axe. This is as nice as any axe I've ever handled...even those costing two or three times the price. Perhaps just a little heavy for backpacking, but perfect for tons else. Great roughing axe for wood crafts and could probably do some light hewing with it. The sheath is also much nicer than expected, full welt and all. The edge was perfectly usable upon arrival, and with less than an hour worth of work, it's now shaving sharp. Holds a great edge as well with only minor touch ups needed so far. Even if this axe was double the price, it would be well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good steel, horrible handle hanging job.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the head is a quality steel. But the hanging job is as everyone says...trash. The entire back side of the handle does not even contact the metal. I can slip a card almost up the middle part of the head. I’ll be calling to ask about a replacement or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great little pack axe.
customer_reviews.text: I have a few small axes. This is the biggest. This is still my favorite. Took my first camping trip alone with this. Between this my bahco, and my tops, that nights fire was great, but the steak for breakfast took the cake. I know this axe will stay with me till I'm old and gray. I'll have to replace the handle eventually, but such is the nature of a wooden handled axe. Husqvarna is close to my heart.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Reile

customer_reviews.title: I am returning it and will update this review if I am pleased with the new one
customer_reviews.text: Well... The axe I received must have been a fluke.... unless anyone happens to inform me otherwise... because the axe head was slightly warped to one side... I am not sure if this is intended of it (as Ii have never own a carpenters axe before) or if this is a fluke due to its handforged making.... I am returning it and will update this review if I am pleased with the new one
customer_reviews.author: Ben Harkey

customer_reviews.title: GO ahead AXE me if I like it? get one!
customer_reviews.text: This has great balance and hand feel. The axe comes sharp from the shipper (FACTORY) BUT I TUNED IT UP A BIT WITH MY SHARPENING PUCK so I would have the kind of edge I like. It does a wonderful job of all those little camp chores and will even do feather sticking with a little practice. I have yet to attempt any carving with this tool but in the future I will add to this review when I have had a go at it. Right now I am pleased with the performance. It does not feel heavy on the belt and it fits nicely in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Tom English

customer_reviews.title: Both hand forged in Sweden and of excellent steel. The Husqvarna may not be finished as ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small axe for camping and general use. After watch many YouTube reviews this compared well to the Gränsfors Bruk axe. Both hand forged in Sweden and of excellent steel. The Husqvarna may not be finished as nice as the Gränsfors Bruk, but all it takes is a few coats of tung oil on the unfinished handle and perhaps a minor profile of the blade. Something very easy to do with basic skills. This axe is a HUGE step up from anything you will find in a Big Box store.
customer_reviews.author: David in Vancouver

customer_reviews.title: Crudely Sharpened, Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I received this and gave it a once-over. Upon removing the edge guard, I was shocked to find the edge crudely and unevenly sharpened. I can properly resharpen it, but the amount of metal that needs to be removed will significantly diminish the life of the ax. I expected better from Husqvarna. I wonder if these are seconds?
customer_reviews.author: Smoke

customer_reviews.title: Quality at any Price.
customer_reviews.text: This thing fires me up. It looks awesome, sharpens well. I plan to use it in the woodshop to rough out leg tapers or whatever else... and also use it to split kindlin or whatever else. I own the popular Fiskars splitting axe, but this will handle all of my other needs. And I have a chainsaw if I want to cut something down. Lightly sand and put Boiled Linseed Oil on the handle... you'll thank me later. There is no way you can beat this axe without spending a ton of money... and even then, I'm not sure you could convince me this isn't on par with the big names.
customer_reviews.author: TexasPride

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, quality control could use some work.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to buy the Granfors Bruks splitting axe but didn’t want to shell out $200+. Upon opening there were a couple imperfections on my handle. These gashes on the handle were sharp and splintering. So I sanded them down, After sanding down I realized I probably should have taken a picture before I did that... Husqvarna splitting axe is a great deal but don’t expect Gränsfors Bruks or Hults Bruk quality. If the axe were more expensive I’d give 2-3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: factory second??
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe this axe left the factory. So much for unsurpassed Quality.I have several axes and hatchets from Husquvarna, Hults Bruk and Wetterlings so I know what a well made axe is. This last Husquvarna axe has a lop sided forged head and is not on handle straight Do Not Buy anymore on line what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Brosnahan

customer_reviews.title: Ditch your hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I've used this axe a LOT, and all I can say is wow. It's the perfect size for camping/backpacking. Small enough to pack, heavy enough to actually get the job done. As anyone with an axe knows, two important features to have are a heavy axe head, and a long handle, and this has the best of both worlds while still being compact. The blade has a limbing profile, but it does an ok job with light splitting too. Rumor has it these are OEM'd Gransfor Bruks axes, and I have no reason to doubt it with the high quality and balance of these axes.
customer_reviews.author: nukeduster

customer_reviews.title: Good price...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars, except that when I received the axe, whoever ground it overheated part of the edge leaving nice discolored steel for me. Took a few minutes to re-grind the bad steel off...something I didn’t feel I should have had to do.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Great axe. Perfect handle grain pattern
customer_reviews.text: Great axe. Perfect handle grain pattern. The bit looks to be excellent steel and will hold up a very long time. The sheath it comes with is a plus and is actually pretty good quality. Definitely worth the purchase and i would most definitely recommend. Unless you want to spend three to four times the price on a Gransfors Bruks or shop around for a decent axe bit and handle it yourself this Husqvarna is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: Love Sweden; amazing axe.
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best forest axe for the money. The head is hand forged and Swedish made. The handle seemed unfinished and had the correct grain orientation. I cut down a 14” oak that was 30-35 feet tall - no issues. The blade came sharp and is easy to maintain.the leather sheath is suitable for the price you pay and will protect your edge at the very least. It just feels good in my hand. To find a hand forged Swedish axe for less than 100 dollars is just unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: handle quality and hang are clearly superior to an old West Virginia Kelly I have for ...
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet exceeds expectations. The blade symmetry, handle quality and hang are clearly superior to an old West Virginia Kelly I have for easy comparison. The logo stamp is the only flaw. The stamp is ridiculously deep and too close to the cutting edge. This will hopefully not be a problem for a small hatchet used primarily for cutting roots during landscape maintenance. I do believe Husqvarna should rethink this deep stamp as I won't risk buying a larger axe with this stamp because of the greater force a larger blade will experience.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Not my number one axe.
customer_reviews.text: Got it this week. Solid axe. Handle needed sanding and linseed oil. Got to split with it this weekend and it is a pleasure to swing. I put it against my go to fiskars x27. X27 wins in about any category. Husky sticks in wood a bit to much for my liking. Already scarred the handle. It will definitely need protective collar, preferably metal, rubber might do it but would ruin the look of this classsic axe. Lacks power of fiskar for sure. Those extra 6 inches come handy in fiskar. I think husky would be a good axe for kindling. After all that said I am pretty satisfied with husky for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: parshik

customer_reviews.title: Good axe but quality control is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Quality is very much hit or miss with these axes. When you get a good one it really shows. Like many others I had to do some returns to get a properly fitted axe. The weight is fine. And wood is excellent. I took the time to finish the edge and refinish the wood with some boiled linseed oil. Pictures are of the hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Soriano

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic ax for bushcrafting
customer_reviews.text: If you've wanted one of the higher end bushcraft axes you should take a look at this little guy. Razor sharp with a leather scabbard and a head made by Hultafors Burks so the quality is superb but the price is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: Amazing axe for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing axe for the price! Did come with a few dents in the edge from the crappy sheath but were easily fixed with a file, a few stones and a strop. I easily got it shaving sharp and the edge retention since has been more than adequate. I use this thing hard and often and it is my favorite outdoor tool!
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this hatchet. It's the perfect size to have for creating kindling while camping and the quality seems top-notch. The handle felt a little rough upon arrival, but that was remedied easily with a little sanding (which also allowed me to remove the hazard symbols on the backside). I also treated it with 3 coats of linseed oil. The blade came really sharp, but with some burrs that were easily removed with a steel honing rod.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW A BACIS

customer_reviews.title: Super deep stamp in blade !
customer_reviews.text: I throw in a axe league and this axe is the perfect size and weight for the NATF regulations , it is perfectly balanced and easy to throw in that I give it a 5 star review , unfortunately the manufacturer decided to stamp the axe to saw hand forged about Midway back from the edge , it's so deep I'd almost guarantee it's causing a weak point in the blade and is most likely the reason in other reviews they are breaking in half , who in their right mind that knows anything about steel would make it weak on purpose ??? I hope she holds up ! Fingers crossed !!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: I feel bad for the people with negative reviews and product that ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel bad for the people with negative reviews and product that broke. I am telling all of you this is the BADDEST AXE I have ever used!!! Delivery was prompt and I took it out this weekend to Savage Mountain in Vail Colorado - I bought the 26" and I cut down an entire tree with this axe - I split it all up into burnable firewood and even hit on rock (by accident) a few times - I didn't have to resharpen it even once. This axe took a serious beating and I am so proud! I am very very happy with this tool!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Best deal on an axe period...
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure this axe was made by Hults Bruk for Husqvarna. It's quality. I sanded off the stupid decals and finish on the handle and put a coat of boiled linseed oil on it. It will also take an edge on it sharp enough to shave with... Perfect. It's long enough to be used as an axe but short enough for hatchet work. It to me the perfect pack axe and it is balanced and shapely and handles woodworking tasks exactly as I was hoping for. If I could take only one tool with me into the wilderness I think it would be this handy little axe.
customer_reviews.author: HonkyLips

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I put the diamond stones and green compound to mine as soon as I got it. It is shaving sharp and holds the edge very well. I also went over the handle with linseed oil and a scotch-brite pad to burnish it. The head seems slightly heavy for a hatchet of this size, but that's a very small critique considering everything else is just about perfect, including the price.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This would be a really nice axe for the money but the blade has a fracture through it and I am afraid to use it because it will hurt someone. I didn’t notice it when it arrived but when I cleaned it up and I saw to the fracture on both sides of the blade. I contacted Hasqvarna And they said to contact the seller. I’m not sure they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tinney

customer_reviews.title: The grind is terrible. One is expected to profile a new axe ...
customer_reviews.text: The head is well tempered; there were traces of straw color on the face. The grind is terrible. One is expected to profile a new axe blade to one's own taste but the basic grind is very sloppy. The handle is beautiful. The grain is completely straight and oriented perfectly along the handle. It's a total shame that the head is hung 10 degrees off-center. An axe is more than a well-forged head and a straight-grained handle. A decently-forged head _properly_ hung on a mediocre handle is a useable tool. I received an axe-shaped object. The only way to make it into a useable tool is to cut off the handle and hang the head properly.
customer_reviews.author: Wary Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool, a staple for any outdoor trip.
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet was perfect for my last hunting trip and saved my butt a few times. I used it to trim back ambush points, cut up firewood, and even field dress a buck when my bone saw failed miserably. Hands down the best tool I bought and worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Mercer

customer_reviews.title: I could not imagine a better camping ax
customer_reviews.text: I could not imagine a better camping ax!! Smaller than a typical ax or splitting maul but larger than a hatchet. The weight is perfect and effortlessly swings, the handle has great ergonomics and is made of hickory so it is strong and sturdy and the blade is high quality steel that maintains a cutting edge for a very long time! I absolutely love this ax!
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: I've put this thing through the ringer.
customer_reviews.text: I've put this thing through the ringer. Over this month I have nearly processed an entire pecan tree into fire wood. Chopping wood soothes me. It holds an edge very well, and its easy to re hone/sharpen. Handle looks very nice in person and darkens up as you use it. This improves how it looks in my opinion. It has a nicely made leather cover that fits tight. This is what I would expect for the amount of money. I would recommend getting a leather collar to protect your investment and a cheap sharpening stone for quick touch ups between logs, it makes a big difference. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice camp hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I've used this hatchet to trim the branches off poles, to cut and shape tent stakes, drive tent stakes, split firewood. It has done all these jobs well. A good, all round camp hatchet. I also appreciate the blade cover that came with it. Makes it safer to transport. Blade seems to hold an edge well.
customer_reviews.author: RDRR

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased this hatchet looking for something that I could easily put in my pack for camping/bushcraft
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hatchet looking for something that I could easily put in my pack for camping/bushcraft. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and craftsmanship as well as the blade sharpness right out of the box! It's fairly light weight and the curvature of the handle makes for a great all around hatchet. It processes wood very efficiently and has the capability to carve as well. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: benjamin kamins

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price, fantastic hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: Husqvarna makes fantastic woodsman tools. It's no Granfors Bruk, but it will beat any hardware store hatchet that you can find. I am giving it 4, instead of 5 stars, because I was not please with the edge it arrived with. The edge of an axe should be convexed. This one came with a sort of "v-edge". I've sharpened it to a convex, but it would have been 5 stars if it was ground properly.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian427

customer_reviews.title: Great weight but axe arrived sub par.
customer_reviews.text: The axe is a great weight & length for my needs but arrived damaged even though Amazons box was perfect. The metal, which arrived with its leather sheath on, has a small but notable chip on the blade and the handle is not the quality I expected. The handle has a pencil top sized knick in the wood that I will have to sand down. The grain is straight but there are two major runs. The axe is sharp, the metal looks well forged, the weight & length are great, but the quality control is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: London Graf

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully crafted axe!
customer_reviews.text: This axe is really a piece of fine craftsmanship. The handle grain orientation is not perfect, but for this size handle I don't think it is necessary. The handle is solidly in place and there is a slight flare in the wood on the very top from the wedge. This will prevent any movement of the axe head. It came sharp, but not super sharp. About 5 minutes with a sharpening stone yielded a hair splitting edge. The steel appears to be incredible in the ability to sharpen and hold an edge. I applied linseed oil to the handle after sanding it and this is now a thing of beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Day Runner

customer_reviews.title: Beautify Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great handy size for light chopping work around the camp site. Came plenty sharp enough and the quality seems top-notch. The shape of the handle is perfect and the axe feels good in the hand. This is a heirloom quality hand axe that will give you generations of service if treated with respect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 26" Wooden Multi-Purpose Axe
product_meta.description: Style:26" Wooden Multi-Purpose AxeHusqvarna provides a wide range of wooden axes for different kinds of work. These axes are forged in Sweden from Swedish axe steel with a consistently high quality. With good maintenance, your axe will last for a long time. Don't store in too warm conditions, since the handle might Shrink. Always dry of dirt & moisten before putting the axe cover on. If the axe is put away for a longer time, grease it to prevent rust.
feature_bullets: Multi-purpose axe is a single-bit axe in traditional style
Head is attached to the hickory shaft using both a wooden and Steel Wedge to secure fastening
Versatile axe used for tree felling, wood chopping, and other jobs
The long handle provides power to the cut

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,406 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
